meanings.definition: An object or shape that is longer in one direction than it is wide.
meanings.sent1: The field was filled with colorful oblongs of various sizes.
meanings.sent2: She drew a picture of a house with oblongs for windows.
meanings.sent3: The oblongs on the table looked like a group of friendly aliens.
meanings.sent4: His garden was a canvas of oblongs, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The artist used oblongs to represent the passage of time in her painting.

meanings.definition: A rectangle with unequal adjacent sides.
meanings.sent1: The cake was cut into oblongs for easy sharing.
meanings.sent2: The oblongs of the building's windows gave it a modern look.
meanings.sent3: The oblongs in the puzzle were the trickiest to fit together.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were drawn to the oblongs of light peeking through the curtains.
meanings.sent5: The oblongs of the table made it perfect for fitting into small spaces.
